alert.note: Alert for Coastal Hancock; Coastal Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 03 at 9:56PM EST until December 04 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations up to 6 inches with the highest amounts along and north of Route 1. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph. * WHERE...Coastal Hancock and Coastal Washington Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes. Heavy and wet snow combined with gusty winds may lead to isolated power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snowfall is expected during the Monday morning commute. Snowfall rates up to one inch per hour are possible. The consistency of the snow will be heavy and wet.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Expect snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to newengland511.org.
